         "Kabol? You awake?" Cherish asked, opening an eye.
         "What do you need?"
         Cherish looked hesitant. She still laid on her tail next to his head, but she started to look more uncertain. She continued, "I've been wondering, and I know I keep asking, but how do you shrink people? Can you teach me?"
         "I don't shrink people, I shrink people who are a threat to me." Kabol can feel the woman's tail uncoil itself. Kabol stretched his arms as the naga slithered around close tot he fire. He said, "And do you think you can teach me to swallow people whole? Or are you like me, and you were pretty much born with that gift?"
         "Oh..." The woman almost looked disappointed. Kabol sat next to the fire, feeling the woman slither next to him for warmth yet again. She didn't curl around him, rather laid next to him and let him use her body as something to lay against. She started fiddling with his ears playfully before turning away, "Well, it's my turn to keep watch."
13121111111111.title: Kabol has a change of heart and turns her to he...

choices: The longer he walked, the farther the tower looked.
131211111111111.content:
Kabol was amazed and alerted at the sight before him.
         Geysers, hot springs and pools of green-blue crystal clear water in craters. He's glad he left the Badlands, but now he's in an area that just yells 'volcano'. He can smell the sickening scent of sulfur. The sky was a little cloudy, but he assumes that's just from the geysers. Kabol checked his map from his bag. This area was nowhere on it.
         Kabol looked at Cherish. The lamia was glad to be somewhere where the sun didn't bake her like a live pancake. The sky was kind enough to provide shade, at least for now. The heat, in spite of the shade, still existed, just not as prominent. Cherish was more focused on the pools of water.
         When she started to sliver towards them, Kabol jumped in front, "No! Don't touch them. Those pools are extremely hot. Watch." Kabol looked around on the ground for anything to throw. Luckily, he found a beetle. He picked it up and tossed it into a nearby pool. As it broke the surface tension of the water, it made a sizzling sound.
         Cherish looked around, dismayed. There was steam climbing out of large pools of water. There was almost no ground for the lamia to slither on. "How am I going to get through then? Can we go around?"
         "That would be a waste of time. I know a way I can get your through, but I need your permission."
         Cherish frowned. She knew what he meant, what he was planning on doing. Behind her, a scurry was heard. Kabol and Cherish turned to see three vrees climbing over a ledge several meters behind them. Cherish shook her head, quickly agreeing to Kabol's plan.
         Kabol placed his hand on her tail and shrank her. He remembered to pick up her bra this time before placed her in his pocket and running away between the hotsprings. The ledges were thin, but Kabol's natural balance let him keep his footing. One slip could be the end of both him and his lamia friend. He heard a splash and squeals of pain, along with the sound of siring flesh. One of the vrees must have fallen in.
         He made it safely to the other side and hoped up a ridge. The other vrees started to flee. The third one was dead in a pool. Kabol took a breather. It wasn't hard crossing the ridge but the pressure if death was a good motivator; an anxious one too.
         "Yay! You did it." Cherish poked out of his pocket, "Can you let me out now?"
         "I don't think that's an option." Kabol said as he looked to the distance. The pools were cleared up, and there was a little more room to walk. But the room to walk was still little. Cherish put on a pouty face as Kabol started walking.
131211111111111.title: The Hotsprings.

1312111111111111.content:
Kabol stared at a large staircase.
         The question 'Why?' comes to mind. It was carved in the stone of the ground. Cherish popped out of Kabol's pocket, curious as to why they've stopped. "It's just a staircase." Cherish pointed out the obvious.
         The area he was in was clear of any hotsprings and geysers. Now there's just sulfuric rocks, large rocks and large sulfuric rocks along with a pool here or there. Cherish is able to slither around, however, without the fear of getting boiled alive. A slide on rocks were heard behind Kabol. Cherish tried to look over his shoulder, but he didn't allow her.
         "We're being followed. Have been for sometime." He pushed her head back down in his pocket, "Don't look. Alright, so here's the plan. I'm going to bring you back to size, I distract, and you go get her."
         "Her?"
         Kabol turned around, able to something scurry behind a rock just in time. "Yes, her." He set the lamia on the ground and turned her to her original size. After giving her back the bandages, Kabol pointed to his right and motion his arm to tell her to flank. Kabol kept his eyes on the rock. He saw a side of a human face peep from the side of the rock before cowering back.
         Soon the lamia appeared behind her and greeted her before pulling her out into the open and wrapping her tail around her prey. Kabol walked towards the struggling Zerah. The lamia was spinning her as she tightened her grip. Zerah tried to speak but couldn't get the air in her lungs. Kabol rose a hand, "You can stop now."
         "Who are you to tell me what to do?" Cherish sniped. Kabol crossed his arms and tilted his head with a look. Cherish frowned, "Point taken."
         Kabol strode up to the lamia and the curled girl. "Zerah, honey, what part of 'don't follow us or we'll killl you' did you not understand?"
         "Kabol," Zerah gasped in air, "Kabol, listen! I didn't mean any harm, I just want my crossbow back."
         "So you can shoot us?" Kabol slung the crossbow into his arm, "I don't think so. In fact, I think Cherish could use some target practice." Cherish shook her head. Kabol rose an eyebrow, "No? Ah right. Judging by the way she looks at you, she wants you alive and well. Cherish?"
         Cherish placed her hands on Zerah's shoulder and moved her head next to the neck before biting on the chin. Kabol turned, not willing to see the inevitable consumption of the woman.
         "Kabol wait!" Zerah called, "The sorcerer! He doesn't live in the tower, don't go there, it'll lead you to your death. The Naseer- Ah!" She was interrupted as Cherish's jaw unhinged and started to engulf her chin.
         Kabol turned around, "Naseer?"
         Cherish stopped eating the girl and pouted. Zerah coughed out saliva, drool was smeared across her face. After coughing up a fit she managed to spit out, "The Naseer, a great beast at the top of the spire. The sorcerer conjugates the storm to deter explorers. He lives elsewhere, nearby in fact. let me take you to him."
         Cherish folded her arms, "Am I ever going to get to eat anything that isn't already dead? I mean, I could eat her and she could tell you the directions inside, if she's loud enough."
         Zerah squirmed heavily, "No, no, no!"
The lamia's idea isn't too half bad, but entirely unnecessary and risky.
1312111111111111.title: Zerah the Stalker

13121111111111111.content:
"Let her go." Kabol said.
         Cherish hummed hesitantly, "Okay, fine." The lamia turned her head, "Zerah, you get to live. But if you make one step out of line, you're mine. Other than that, we can be friends."
         Cherish released the struggling girl. Zerah biffed the landing and fell on her legs. She tried to recompose herself but Cherish picked up the woman to her feet and pushed her towards Kabol. Zerah took point leading the duo a little off from the direction of the spire. Kabol handed Cherish back her crossbow and kept it pointed at the human.
         She lead them to a rocky formation away from the Hotsprings. One thing Kabol noticed was that there were more and more stairs carved into the rocks the closer he got to the rocks. When they got to it, there was a cliff and a chasm behind the rocks that dropped directly down at least a dozen meters. erah pointed to the side of the cliff she was over, showing that there was a giant door made of stone and wood.
         "He's in there." Zerah pointed out the obvious, "Do you have a way to get down?"
         Kabol pulled out a rope, handing one end to Zerah, "Tie this around your waist." When she was done, Kabol pushed her over the edge. As the rope began to shorten, following her, Kabol tied a quick noose on his end and tossed it on a nearby stalagmite. Once the noose was wrapped around it, the rope tightened and bounced. An 'Umph' noise was heard from the chasm.
         Kabol slid down the rope. The woman was two meters in the air. dangling. "What the hell is your problem?" She sniped at Kabol.
         Kabol hopped off the rope at a safe distance, "What? Humans don't land on their feet?"
         Cherish slithered down from stalactite to stalactite until she reached the bottom. She was memorized by the scale of the door. It had intriguing engravings of dragons and wizards of old time past. Dozens, maybe even a hundred creatures and people were fighting dragons. They look like hours of work was put into each character. Despite being out numbered, the dragons were flying above the ground and keeping the battle at a stalemate.
         "This is amazing." Cherish said.
         "Can't wait til I see the inside." Kabol complimented the work.
         "A little help?" Zerah called, unwilling to tie herself from the height she's at.
         Kabol and Cherish silently agreed to ignore her and tried to open the doors. They were heavy, but Kabol managed to open it once he stepped on a stone button on the ground. The doors slid open, hovering just above the ground. Cherish and Kabol headed inside to see the walls were carved with intricate art just like the door. Flames flickered on torches next to them, showing the detail to an almost lifelike design. Kabol looked hard at one of the creatures, a naga curled around a warring dwarf, and was able to see the veins in between the muscles and skin if he looked hard enough.
         Such design was impossible for anything human, or hybrid-like.
         The hallway poured open into an auditorium. The ceiling and walls were meters high, all with detail, until a few meters to the back where the walls were as flat as slate. There was a gaping hole in the ground on the far end of the room. A growl was heard from it, and out crawled...
13121111111111111.title: Go with Zerah's plan

choices: Zerah was missing, as was half their supplies.
Zerah was still there, dangling like an ornament.
131211111111111111.content:
A growl was heard from it, and out came a large dragon.
         It had blood red scales all of it's body, along with black spikes and a tan underbelly. It's teeth were stubby, and looked as if they were used to hold prey. It's eye were a burning amber, with a glistening glare. Every step it took, the ground felt like it trembled.
         Cherish didn't have feet to worry about losing hold of. Kabol lost his footing. He fell on his hands, thinking he sprained them. He checked to see if his wrists and the blades accompanying them were okay, and as he did noticed a small ladder on the wall. It's only fifty centimeters. It looks as if it's thin enough for a rodent to use. next to it were small carving tools on the ground. On the ground was another hole.
         The pristine sculptures, the lifelike carvings, all made sense now.
         The dragon stood high and mighty, nearly his head only a few meters from the ceiling. It stared blankly at the two, without a peep, sound, growl or roar.
         Cherish closed her eyes and her body and tone took a humble sense. "Oh great and mighty wizard," She bowed deeply, placing her hands in the air beside her hips as if she was wearing skirt, "We graciously and humbly ask that you assist us in our endeavors."
         Kabol stood to his feet, concentrating on the hole in the ground and walking towards it, "Cherish," he said, "that's not the wizard, that's a dragon."
         Cherish' eyes opened widely. She was frozen in posture and a frown grew on her face. The dragon dived it's head in and grabbed the lamia with it's blunt-toothed jaws. Her tail was sticking out, but not struggling too much, unwilling to risk getting bit in half. Her human half, however, was quite the opposite, wailing in protest.
         Kabol didn't worry about her. The teeth wouldn't be able to pierce a leaf, and if she's swallow, he could just go in and get her. Instead, Kabol was more interest in the hole. He was near enough to it and tapped his foot on the ground. "Knock, knock, you have company. I know you're in there, I can smell you." The hole was still dormant. Kabol added, "It's alright, I'm not going to eat you. Speaking of which, your dragon out here is nomming on my friend, if you could do something about that... Before I do?"
         Soon scurrying was heard in the hole and out popped an anthropomorphic mouse. He was tan furred and dress in an extravagant gown. His brown hair dropped behind his shoulder and he fixed his foggy spectacles. He waved, "Hello there, good cat, how may I help you?"
         Kabol heard the winged lizard behind him make an almost crunching noise on the woman's scales as it tried to get a better position to gobble her up; her please becoming fainter. "Well, there's that." Kabol shot a thumb behind him, "But first, I was wondering if you could get a curse off of me."
         "A curse? That's easy what kind?"
         "Immortality," Kabol responded, hearing the soft crunch noise again, "with a dash of intensified pain."
         The wizard shook his head, "Immortality? That's going to be a bother. I do know the spell, and how to cast it, but it requires something... Unattainable."
         "True love?"
         "The blood of the Naseer."
         "Got it!" Kabol stood up and headed towards the door. He almost skipped in joy.
         "Wait your not going to ask who, or what or what?" The wizard asked, getting used to having company.
         "Nope! I'll be back with a head of a spirit-forsaken naseer head." Without turning, he changed his tone, "Cherish, quit playing with the dragon and come on, we're leaving."
         "Mph!" She squealed back, almost entirely consumed by the creature.
         The mouse ordered the dragon to let her go, calling it by the name Asmodeus. It obeyed, lowering its head and letting her roll onto the ground. She gasped for air and quickly slithered away next to Kabol.
         "I'm not having fun out here anymore, can we go home? Seems everywhere we go, someone is in someone else's mouth. I'm the victim most of the time."
         Kabol wrapped an arm around her snakelike hips, the human half wet with dragon drool, "When you're traveling through a gullet made of teeth, you have my permission to complain. Until then, bear with me."
         The duo open the doors, via a button.
131211111111111111.title: The Wizard

choices: Let's go kill the Naseer, and explain to Cherish why she'd want to do that.
1312111111111111111.content:
Kabol sighed.
         The rope was cut. Zerah was gone. So was his sleeping bag and half the food. Kabol also noticed the lack of Cherish's crossbow. He rolled his eyes, noticing the lamia's worried look.
         "She's gone..." Cherish stated the obvious, but it was mostly out of disbelief.
         "Can I just take a moment of contemplation to take in what we've been through?" Kabol started to count off using his fingers, "I got you shrunk multiple times, fun while it lasted; I've been on a slave train, literally; I've traversed lands never explored only to meet more humans, who either died or were jerks; I got eaten trying to save someone, never got a thank you; chased by vrees, almost got boiled alive, stalked, agreed to kill a magnificent beast and now our stuff is stolen. Cherish, do you want to write a book with me when we get home? Because I've yet to figure out if this is a normal story."
         Cherish was about to say something, but Kabol kicked a biscuit of bread off the ground in anger.
         "I was so close!" He yelled, flipping off the cut rope that dangled meters in the air. There isn't enough food here to make a journey back. If he does remove his immortality, he'll starve to death.
         Cherish slithered, "Kabol-"
         "Lady, I'm royally pissed out of my mind to the point I'm begging myself not to murder that dragon in there." Kabol grit his teeth. Cherish was about to speak once more but Kabol continued, "I should have killed her. But that would have been impolite. How the hell did she get herself cut down?"
         "Kabol!" Cherish screamed and wrapped herself around his body. His hands were kept out of the coils and pinned straight. He had trouble breathing. Any tighter and his ribs may start to give. Only his head stuck out from her grip. Cherish grabbed Kabol's chin, forcing him to look at her.
         Her face was the face a disappointed mother, "Shut up and listen to me! This whole time I've been taking crap from you, with you, and for you. You're not in this alone. We don't have food, but I can hunt. We don't have rope, but I can climb. I could go home, but I choose not to leave your hide here because we're friends; you're not alone. So quite your griping and pick up your crap. Or am I going to have to kill the Naseer for you?"
         Kabol didn't respond, just murmured.
         "That isn't an answer."
         "Can't... breathe." Kabol peeped.
         Cherish released him and dropped him on the ground. She picked up his stuff and put it all in a bag before handing it to Kabol and tossing him on her back. She slithered up the stalagmites and stalactites. She reached the top of the cliff. She pulled Kabol off and gave him a tight hug, before tossing him on the ground. "Okay friend," She began in a much more polite tone, crossing her arms, "We could go after Zerah, get some good tasty revenge, or you and I can kill that Naseer thing and get this adventure over with. What do you want to do?"
         Kabol brushed dust from his coat and hat...
1312111111111111111.title: Zerah was missing, as was half their supplies.

choices: The Naseer, a large hulking monster, crawled from a hole in the ceiling.
13121111111111111111.content:
"Let's go kill a Naseer." Kabol smiled and pointed towards the spire.
         Cherish shared the same smile and slithered in the direction of the rocky formation. For the first time in a long time, Kabol was excited. Excited to be with Cherish, excited to see the Naseer and excited to rid his curse. Cherish also seemed excited. She slithered fast like she had a purpose. Kabol did his best to hang on without letting his head bang into the back of hers.
         While on her back, he began to think of all she's been through; through all the things she put up for him. He never figured out why, be he wants to assume it isn't because she thgouth her life was on the line. It hasn't been in some time.
         Kabol, for the first time in a long time, felt warm inside. He found a new friend.

         Some time has past. Kabol was at the base of the rocky spire. It was kilometers high. The storms covered the pinnacle. Its clouds were violet and the lightning was completely silent. Sharp rocks jut our of the sides and surrounding area. Other than that, it was completely barren. Kabol wondered what this tower was used for before the Naseer came. He wondered if the Naseer made it or if it's always been a scary, no-good, spooky-dooky horror rock with no soul since its conception.
         "Alright, let's go." Kabol strutted towards the dark, evil spire of doom only to be tugged back. Cherish held a hard grip on his coat. Kabol looked up the arm and then straight in Cherish's eyes. She kept her glare on the rocks. Kabol hesitated, "What's the big deal?"
         "Kabol..." She began, "I was wondering if we could eat together. It may be our last time together, I mean, I'm not saying we will die, but... Just in case, I want to at least have one meal with you." She finally looked down and met him at eye level, and with her voice almost cracking from the pressure of death asked, "Please?"
         Kabol saw what she meant and nodded. He sat against a spiky rock. The only things left are some loafs bread that's been kicked and a couple of pears from some cacti you snagged from the badlands. It's a terrible last meal, but it will do.
         "Kabol," Stress intruded her voice, "I heard about your, uhm, curse when the dragon was... Anyways, you want to rid yourself of immortality?"
         "Yes," Kabol admitted, "I know, it sounds stupid. It wouldn't be too bad if I didn't feel more pain than I used to. That's the worse part. A slap could feel like a blow from a hammer. A sun burn feels like actual fire. Things like that. People say immortality is a curse on it's own. Everyone you know and love will constantly die, beauty becomes a myth, and you'll spend eternity alone. But honestly, it isn't that mad. You get used to everything, and what is eternity to an immortal?" Kabol noticed he got off track, "It's the physical pain of this world that drives the everlasting insane. You can get eaten, crushed, stabbed, crushed, thrown around, crushed and all around you just fear large objects in general."
         Cherish finished her food while he was talking, "That's terrible.:
         "It's not all bad I guess. I can shrink things! Oh, the look on a predators face when-" Kabol stopped remembering Cherish's terrified face, "I- well."
         Cherish slithered and gave Kabol a hug, "You're a terrifying person, you know that?"
         Kabol closed his eyes and sullied in her embrace. The warm feeling flared up again. "Cherish," he began, "Why did you stick with me all this time?"
         "I could tell you." Cherish smirked, "But I won't. Not until the Naseer's dead. It's so you and I have something to look forward to." She hugged tighter. All of Kabol's problems felt like they melted away, "Just makes sure I don't die."
         For a moment he thought of the idea to just give up the chase and go home with her. But he can't, not that he didn't want to, but he's sure she would never let him do that. They prepared to continue to hunt down the Naseer.
         A large arch of stone and spikes that looked artificially made. The stone under his feet turned to tiles. As he entered, Cheish's words rung in his head.
                   "Just make sure I don't die."
13121111111111111111.title: The Naseer's domain

choices: The queen is infuriated and orders you killed by any means.
The queen realizes that she won't be able to pass and leaves.
The queen explains that her daughter ran away and is in the room.
132.content:
Kesh stared at the grandfather clock at the end of the hallway as its pendulum swayed back and forth. This had to be one of his dullest jobs yet, for what it was going to pay. One would expect there to be bandits and monsters breaking coming in endless waves for a job that paid for about eight months of his living expenses. Still, here Kesh was. Sitting beside a old wooden door and making sure nobody entered the room. Suddenly, a shadow slipped across the grandfather clock. Kesh had some company.
         Kesh stood up and placed himself in front of the door while three shady-looking people walked down the hallway. One of them had a white robe with glowing orange and red thread. The other two people had simple black cloaks and followed the person in the middle. They stopped about three feet from the guard and the one in the middle simply said.
         "Let us pass. We have urgent business with the occupant of that room." Kesh just blinked as a proud woman's voice ordered him to let them pass. They stood there waiting for Kesh to let them through.
         "Sorry miss, my job is to not let anyone into this room. Please vacate this building the same way you came." He said it and stood firm as the woman in the middle removed her hood. Kesh instantly recognized her face.
         "I, the currently reigning queen of this country, demand you move aside. This does not concern a common guard off the streets. And if you wish to continue, my personal escorts will dispatch you of your current job and possibly your life." Her eyes were emotionless as well as her face, but Kesh simply tightened the shield onto his arm in response.
         "Even though you are the current queen of this country, I have been given a job and I will see it finished. Please remove yourselves from this building and I promise none of you will be harmed." Kesh stared straight into the queen's eyes and got into defensive stance.
         "Do you seriously think that a commoner can fight on par with not one, but two of the elites of the royal army? Victoria, end this arrogant man's life." The queen simply motioned for the woman on her right and their was a sword already flying towards Kesh's heart.
         Kesh simply lifted his shield up, deflecting the strike into the wooden door, and with a quick bash the blade snapped about a inch from the hilt. The girl's hood fell and she was just staring at what was left of her weapon in shock. Kesh then knocked the blade out of the door and slid it the girl.
         "I'm sorry about your sword, but I will only give one more warning. Leave or I will remove you by force."
132.title: Kesh

choices: Ish-Pan wakes from a prison of dreams.
Nixie is finally able to turn back into a human...
135.content:
Okay, for the first character, Ish-Pan, I will give a basic introduction. But Nixie is a wild card for whoever wishes to pick up on her story and I couldn't think of any other way to introduce her, so I gave you the legend of the Mermaid of Redfalls' Lake.

5. Ish-Pan, the child of a succubus and a slime-nymph. Ish-Pan was once a young boy with tan skin and short white-blond hair. Now, he appears to be a young man that has ghastly white skin and straight, messy hair that seems black enough to absorb light and is sealed into a local shrine. He has been asleep for years having dreams of his best friend, first love, and the girl he forced to seal him into this prison. His seal has been broken...

6. Nixie, the mermaid of Redfalls' Lake. "There were once four sister's, all born of the most beautiful woman ever to live in our town of Redoak, as well the founder of this town's only four children. They were so enchanting that men would abandon their loves and wives to attempt to court one of the sisters. Eventually, the women who lost their love's eye grew envious of the sisters and planned to murder them to claim back what they had lost.
         So all the women got together and arranged a party for all the women in town, making sure that the four sisters would attend, then after everyone had arrived they lured the sisters to the small stream that poured into the lake from a large cliff. The oldest of the four sister's realized their plan when she saw weapons that were in the hands of their fellow townsfolk. She got in front of her three younger sisters elongating their life by being a shield, she was gutted like a fish for attempting to stop the women. And so, The first of the sister's dropped into the stream spilling her life into the flowing water and over the cliff's edge. The second sister attempted to flee, but was quickly cut down by a woman who thought that it would be funny if the sisters who ran had their legs cleaved off. Her blood filled the stream as well. The third oldest sister pleaded for her life and had her tongue cut out and her lungs pierced with wooden stakes. Her blood flowed into the waterfall and into the lake.
         Lastly the woman converged on the youngest of the four daughter's. Her eyes were staring into the crowd of women, they had no fear. For a girl who had not come of age, she stared at all of the women with boiling hatred she spat in the nearest woman's face and screamed at them.
         "What good does killing four innocent girl's do? Does it make you happy? Do you think that your former loves and husbands will ever return to the woman that killed the person who stole their heart? And I swear you and your blood will join my sister's crimson blood and me in the lake."
         With those harsh, painfully truthful words she jumped off the cliff and onto the rocks below. All of the woman looked over the cliff, seeing the small girl who's name was Nixie crumpled up between the rocks at the base of the cliff. Some of the women realized that what she said was true, flinging themselves over the cliffs edge. Others attempted to return to their husbands and loves, who either rejected their existence or flung themselves over the cliff in the name of love. Those poor women that were left alone joined the sister's they murdered by either jumping off the cliff or drowning themselves in the bloody water.
         Finally, after the remaining townspeople gathered and began to bury their dead they realized that the youngest of the four sister's was missing from the dead and that there small handprints and drag marks from where the youngest sister's body fell. The founder of this town, Lord Redoak looked towards the stained red water of the lake and saw a young girl with crimson hair waving at him. It was Nixie and it is said she still lives in the lake, waiting to return to land when the stained water forgets the sins of the town's people."
135.title: Choices, Choices...

choices: His seal is broken by a priest attempting to bless the legendary landmark.
His seal is broken by a thief who is being pursued for a crime she didn't commit
His seal gives way to time and the landmark has become the center of a monestary
1351.content:
Ah... How many years... How many years since I've seen sunlight... How many years since I've felt the warmth of the brightness... Too long... It's been far, far too long...

         "Hea... -ey..." A blurry noise began to fade into the darkness, almost like someone's voice.
         "Hey! Sludge fer' brains! Wake up already. It's almost noon." Suddenly, the endless abyss gave way to the sight of a girl. Her long blond hair and sky blue eyes sparkled in the sunlight, as well a drop of spit dangling from her mouth. It is wiggling a few inches from the end of a nose... My nose. A pair of arms shoot up and push the girl back, forcing her to suck the saliva back into her mouth.
         "Eli-Beth. I sware if you ever actually spit on me like that. I'll, I'll get a bunch of frog eggs and put It in your tea!" A pouty voice said with a childish tone... My voice... Has it... Has it really been that long?
         "Well, Pan, if you ever did that I'd do it twice!" Her voice was filled with a smug happiness and her smile gave off a overconfident radiance... How I miss that snobby smile...
         The darkness began to engulf the image of a girl smiling and a hand reached out trying to grab it before is faded... My hand reached for the fading image.

         This darkness... I wish... I wish that I could see the light... No, I wish I could see that smile... Her smile, one last time...

         A sliver of light split the void in two, but gave sight to a much darker scene.

         A woman with raven back hair and near flawless body with the complexion of fresh snow bounced on a married man like a wild beast. His hair grew whiter and his skin grew paler as the woman continued to thrust her hips and moan loudly, then without any warning the man went limp. His eyes were glazed over and his face had a expression of fear and regret. This was the power of a succubus... This was the power of my mom...
         "I thought you were gonna be a lot better than this, hun. I mean, with how loudly your dear wife screams at night I thought that you had to be great." She unmounted from the man's still throbbing rod and slid down.
         "I guess your wife is just really sensitive. Maybe she'll be my next partner..." She licked up the shaft of the dead man's penis and continued talking.
         "I mean it's only fair that if I sleep with you I sleep with her." The woman then gave her new toy a kiss with her scarlet lips, a kiss that quickly turned into a throat-deep swallow.
         A shaking hand raised and quivered with fear.

         Oh... That's the night... The night I realized I wasn't human... The night... I ended that murderous monster... The night I forced Elisabeth to seal me away... I miss her so much...

         The hand quivered as it curled into a fist of sheer fury. Everything grew warm... My blood was boiling. A leg... No, My leg... kicked open the door and my mother spun around. My fist slammed straight in between her two large breast... The blood... Her blood had already begun to dribble down her skin... Yet her look of surprise only grew into a twisted smile.
         "I see you finally found out. Good. You should know that this is what we are." She paused and looked at the fist embedded in her chest.
         "No, you are more than this. Not only are you my son. You are also that beautiful dryad's son." She coughed up some blood with a chuckle.
         "Your other mother was a very unique monster. She was half slime, half dryad, and the only being to last long enough to impregnate me." This time she laughed like she had no worries.
         "The only one out of millions of beings I've killed in my immortal lifetime, what a funny thought." She just stared at me and continued to smile with her twisted red lips.
         I got so mad. I wanted to scream at her. I wanted to beat her until she couldn't do this to anyone ever again... I wanted to kill her...
         I lifted my arm away from her chest and punched. And punched. And punched. I didn't stop punching, until I couldn't feel my arms. They were so numb...
         "I'm immortal, remember? You can't kill a immortal being unless you erase their entire body from existence, silly boy." Her smile hadn't faded and blood was pouring from her mouth and the small hole in her chest. I looked at my hands... they were so mangled they looked more like mauled strips of flesh than hands... My body had become goo-like, I had lost the stability of my physical from attacking her so brutally...

         I hated her... I hated her so much... She just murdered my friend's father... My best friend's father...

         The torn flesh... My flesh... Had become red sludge. The goo had began to move on it's own leaking into the hole in her chest... I knew it was going to destroy her heart, but I let it... I felt as the heart began to melt...
         "I killed my mother by throwing her into a pool of holy water... She suffered dearly for murdering my best friend and his family... I guess... Like mother, Like son..." With that the last of her heart sank into the sludge that had turned pitch black... I had turned pitch black...

         I remember... I remember the pain and rage I felt... My mother had always told me that murder was the ultimate sin... Yet she lived murder... No, she was born to murder... I can remember everything that happened after my mother died... It's such a blur...
         After my body returned to normal I ran... I ran straight to my best friend... Elizabeth... I told her everything... She just stared in horror... I had changed... My skin looked like it had never seen the sun and my hair had grown long and was stained black... She was two years older than me and I towered over her by at least a foot... I could never return to my old life... I ran to our favorite spot... A old rock...
         I was crying... Elizabeth followed me... She never said anything until she gave me a strange piece of paper... She told me it was the only way I would find peace... A witch-made sealing talisman... The next part happened so slowly... It hurt so much... My heart hurt so much...

         "Pan. I'm sorry about your mother." Elisabeth had a sad look on her face normally enthusiastic face.
         "Eli-Beth, I'm really sorry about your dad." I could hear the words escaping my mouth, but it wasn't my voice... It sounded like my mother's...
         Elisabeth placed the talisman on the rock and muttered something under her breath. It began to glow along all the strange symbols and so did I. I had already began to vanish.
         "Elizabeth! I have liked you for a really long time." The words flew out of my mouth, I couldn't help them. She ran up and embraced my disappearing form, tears were streaming down her face.
         "I've known that for a long time Ish-Pan, I've had the same feelings for you." With a smooch the world turned black... How I miss my old life...
1351.title: Diveing into the Darkness

14.content: Well, you're not a human. So what are you? A dragon? A Troll? Who knows...
14.title: A monster.

143.content:
A rust red head popped out of the pond. Carefully looking around, the slime searched for threats. Seeing only a couple of birds and a squirrel, she climbed the rest of the way out. Standing up she stretched, her body distorting before snapping back into the shape of a slender young woman. Cautiously she walked towards the abandoned castle. Her caution was not with out cause. Once a wandering troll had caught her on the castle grounds and had smashed her with a hammer. While it hadn't really hurt, a slime's being being tied to an almost indestructible gem rather than their gelatinous outer bodies, it had forced her to spend days hiding in her pond recuperating. Frankly she didn't really need to stay at this castle. She could easily drain her pond and search for a new place to live. But she stayed here.
Slimes lived by absorbing and discharging liquids, as evidenced by the damp footprints that she left. But they could acquire a taste for other things. Some slimes loved jewels, ending up in treasuries and dragon hordes. Others became fond of paper and ink, their moist bodies becoming the bane of libraries. This particular slime loved metals. She had been minding her own business, at the river were she lived with other slimes, when someone started scooping them up into bottles. A day later and a bump in the road found her sitting outside this castle. She had found the pond to soak in and regain her strength. Then she had gone exploring. And found it. Rusted armor and tarnished swords lay scattered around the castle. At first she had only looked, wondering what they were. Then curiosity got the better of her and she put the rusted tip of a knife in her mouth. Now every piece last piece of arms in the castle gleamed and her body had turned into the color of the rust she had consumed. She loved cleaning, and loved even more the taste of a clean metal blade, or a polished breastplate.
She froze in place at the sound of heavy footsteps. Panicked she looked around for a place to hide before diving into a suit of armor, squeezing her body through the open visor. Reorienting herself, she peeped through the visor, then held very still as someone came into view.
"So how long has this castle been abandoned?" The slime heard a woman's voice coming from the boots in front of her.
"It's hard to tell," A man's voice replied. "Given that monsters tend to end up in places like these, the upkeep and decay can be fairly erratic. Some creatures have almost a compulsion to maintain their living space." The man had musical accent. "Others do the opposite and take pleasure in destroying their surroundings."
A low gruff voice spoke up. "So what has been living here."
"What ever it is, it definitely does some cleaning." The woman said. "Look at the shine on this blade." The soft rasp of metal on stone echoed through the hall. With a start, the slime sat up, completely forgetting that she was hiding. They were touching her metal!
"Look out!"
"Sorcery!"
The slime looked around, confused by the shouting. At one end of the hall she say two men, one elf and one dwarf drawing their weapons. Then she saw a human woman holding a sword. It was one of her favorites, a long bladed hand and a half sword with a hilt wrapped in bronze wire. And that woman had it. The slime thought she said something, she must have because the woman started and tossed the sword at her. While the slime juggled the sword, the human rushed her. The slime reacted. The sword hilt fell neatly into one hand. The other hand lashed out, armored knuckles smashing into the woman's brow.
"Anne!" The slime whirled around. The human's companions looked on in shock as the woman dropped cold. There was a moment of indecision as they decided wither or not to attack what they saw as an animate suit of armor Then a roar filled the castle. A roar of the kind everyone recognized. "Troll!" The dwarf yelled, "Run!"
The slime didn't want to tangle with the troll again. But at the same time, she knew would happen to the woman if she got left there.
143.title: A Slime.

1431.content:
Wondering what she was doing, the slime grabbed the unconscious woman by the shoulders and dragged her towards the a staircase. The entrance hall was the only place the troll could get to inside. If she stayed quite, the troll shouldn't notice her. Still she held very still. As the trolls heavy footsteps shook the castle. She heard the troll huff and puff, as it looked around the room. The woman, Anne, stirred.
"Hnn," The slime clamped her hand over Anne's mouth, "Shh!"
"Hmmm!" Anne quickly woke up and struggled in the armored slime's grip. "Hmmm!'
"Troll!" The slime hissed. At that Anne froze. Everyone knew better than to take a troll without a trained squad. A massive foot planted itself at the base of the stairs. The slime knew from experience that the troll couldn't reach up the stairs. That wouldn't stop it from trying to go through the wall if it thought something was there. The foot stayed there for a minute, before a load noise echoed through out the castle. Then the troll stomped away. The two females gagged at the stench of the trolls fart. At the slime's signal the human followed her up the stairs.

Anne followed the strange creature into an empty room, were it drew the moth eaten drapes aside from an arrow hole and peeked. The armor was smallish. More suited to woman or boy than a grown knight. In her mind, animated armor would explain the pristine condition of the weapons in the castle. "Excuse me. Sir Armor?"
"Who?" The creature turned around. "Oh do you mean me?"
"Yes." Anne said, "Can you tell me what manner of sorcery animates you?"
"Sorcery? What are you talking about?' Genuine confusion emanated from the suit. "Oh! I'm still wearing this." The armor reached up and fiddled with something at its neck before removing the helmet. Anne looked on in shock as the rust red head of the slime was revealed. "Hi!"
"You're a slime? What are you doing in that armor?"
"Hiding from you." The slime said like it was obvious. "You're Anne right? Sorry for hitting you. I just didn't want you touching my metal."
"Buh wha?' Anne stuttered. "Your metal?"
"Well I live here, and no one else was taking care of it. So, my metal."
Anne rubbed her temple. If framed from a slime's point of view she supposed it made perfect sense. "Do you... Wait, what's your name anyway?" The slime responded with a complicated series of burbles. Anne couldn't even begin to remember what the slime just said let alone try to pronounce it. "I can't say that. Can I just call you..." She cast around for a name, before settling on a color. "Rusty. Can I call you Rusty?"
"Sure."
"Rusty, then. Do you really need all this metal?"
"Well, no." The newly named Rusty answered. "And it isn't really all that safe taking care of it with that troll coming in and out."
"So would it be okay if me and my partners took some of it with us?"
Rusty thought about it for a moment. She didn't really need all this metal. The armor and that sword would be enough, now that she thought about it. "Were your partners that elf and dwarf? Because they took off when they heard the troll."
"Those bastards left me for dead?!" Anne could actually believe it, unfortunately. Neither of those males were the finest examples of their respective races. "I suppose they took the cart with them."
"Cart?" Rusty looked thoughtful. "Big wooden box with wheels, right? I know were there's one. We can use it to take the metal with us."
"You have a cart? That's great! Wait," Anne stopped and went over what Rusty just said, "What do you mean by us?"
"I'm coming with you of course. If your gonna take all my metal, there's no real reason for me to stay here." Rusty started for the stairs, "And I'm starting to get tired of always running from that troll."

Hours later, the small cart was loaded up with weapons and armor. Anne and Rusty looked upon their handy work with pride. Until Anne noticed something, "What's going to pull the cart."
"I will," Rusty, her head once more covered by the helmet, stepped into the harness. Anne looked on doubtfully. Rusty was shorter than than the human. She didn't think the small slime could pull the loaded cart. She was wrong. Without any visible effort Rusty pushed against the harness and pulled the cart out of the castle with Anne following.
1431.title: Anne

info.brief_description: This is about a world of magic which is inhabited by monsters and humanoid races.
info.description:
This is a rewrite or recreation of my first interactive story. I'm not very good at English (grammar or spelling) and can't describe very well so please help where you can by adding new chapters or emailing me, changes I could make thanks

Basic back story

This story is about a person (human, humanoid race, hybrid races or even monster races) trying to make a live for them selfs in the chaotic magical world of Dawnwake. The human race first appeared in Dawnwake 400 years ago but no one knows how or why. Humans live in a small area on the southern edge of the continent. The weather and environment is very similar to England's environment (I am working on a map to go with this story so bare with me).The humans that live in Dawnwake have medieval technology and architecture. Not much of the world of Dawnwake has been explored so that leaves a lot of options open to explore.

Humans and monsters don't get on, a few races like the elves and dwarfs are accepted as Humanoid races and some lower monster races have been domesticated or tamed but for the most part there is a constant war against the monsters.

Rules
1. No one sentence chapters please
2. I will allow almost any fetish be it vore or anything else
3. Do not kill main charters please it will kinda kill the story then.
4.Have fun with it most of the world is unexplored so take Your chosen person anywhere
5.I'm doing the Chris arc 1,1,1,1,1 ... etc so please do not add to it ( if you have a suggestion please email me) but you can add to any of the other options under the Chris arc
6. Any chapters that do not follow these rules may be deleted or edited by me

Thats all i can think of at the moment so enjoy and by all means email me if u have suggestions or criticism i will try to reply as soon as i can.
